question: I am in love with a pious Muslim girl in my area, and wish to propose to her, but I donâ€™t know how to.
answer:
QUESTION
Salaam. I am a student at the moment and don?t have a job, though I will be getting a part-time job soon, Inshallah. I wish to propose to her soon after, but don?t not know which way to do so. I don?t want to ask someone to ask her for me, as I would not want anyone else to know if she said no, but I don?t know how and what I should do, if it is at all aloud in Islam, for me to ask her directly. Jazakallah for writing to the institute regarding your plans for the future.%0D%0ABrother, seeing that you have decided that a certain lady is the person you%0D%0Awould like to marry, ask a senior person in your family or your parents to%0D%0Aapproach her parents with a proposal. My hope is that you have chosen her%0D%0Afor her piety and not for any other worldly reason. As she is not your%0D%0Amahram, it is not acceptable for you to talk to her nor approach her%0D%0Adirectly. You say you are deeply in love with her. You have to however%0D%0Aremember that dating and being alone with her is not allowed in Islam as%0D%0Aintermingling with non-mahram women is haraam.%0D%0A%0D%0AIf Allah Ta'ala has willed her for you as your wife she will be so. You%0D%0Amention that you will be heart broken if you cannot marry her. Allah Ta'ala%0D%0Aknows what is best for you and it appears that you are a young person. Put%0D%0Ayour faith and hope in your Creator and not in fellow human beings. We are%0D%0Amortal, fallible and totally dependent on our Creator. If she doesn't accept%0D%0Ayour proposal and you do not get to marry her, make dua that Allah Ta'ala%0D%0Awill grant you better. There is no point in becoming morose and deflated%0D%0Aover a matter like this. If she rejects your proposal, you have time to find%0D%0Aemployment, develop your skills and then seek a suitable partner later.%0D%0AYou could also spend more time learning about deen and what your%0D%0Aresponsibilities are as a husband and how you should fulfill the rights of%0D%0Ayour wife, children and the rest of your family. There are so many positive%0D%0Athings you could do with your time as you prepare for your life as a married%0D%0Aman. The responsibilities of being a husband are great and insha'allah if%0D%0Ayou learn to approach this task with the sunnah alive in your heart, you%0D%0Awill be successful as a husband and father.%0D%0A%0D%0AMay Allah Ta'ala grant you the ability to accept His plans for you and may%0D%0AHe also grant you a pious wife. Ameen.%0D%0AAnd Allah Ta'ala knows best.%0D%0A%0D%0ASister Fadila%0D%0ASocial Department%0D%0A%0D%0ACHECKED AND APPROVED: Mufti Ebrahim Desai
